intro: Hetaeria angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hetaeria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland environments and has slender, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. Hetaeria angustifolia is noted for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
